Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero's '68 zombie classic Night of the Living Dead inspired a subgenre full of films that explored how people responded to the undead and often had plenty of grisly gore. Unfortunately the search party are also under the same experience and this is where the real problem begins.
